title: Twist Grip - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Detach the brake light switch and bracket from the master cylinder.
Remove the two fixings and detach the switch housing from the handlebar.

body.name: Detach front master switch housing cjos

body.body: Note the orientation of the twist grip position sensor for installation.
Remove the fixings securing the twist grip position sensor to the master cylinder. Discard the fixings.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork or frame. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Release the fixings and remove the clamp from the master cylinder. Detach the master cylinder from the handlebar and support it in an upright position.
Fixings for the twist grip position sensor
Note the position and orientation of the twist grip to its position sensor for installation.
Slide the twist grip off the handlebar.
